        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()

      • register

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> register()

        Returns:
        EventHandler to register user

      • login

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> login()
        Login function. Checks if username and password are valid. Upon successful authentication the device form is displayed Displays error message if auth fails. Case statuses: -1 for an error, 0 for username / password mismatch, 1 for success, 2 for user doesn't exits
        Returns:
        Returns an EventHandler to handle when the login button is clicked.

      • switchToDeviceScene

        public void switchToDeviceScene(java.lang.String username)
        Switches from the current login scene to the device scene This should be triggered on successful authentication.
        Parameters:
        username - - Username of the user that has authenticated

      • generateMenu

        public javafx.scene.control.MenuBar generateMenu()
        Builds menu for different colour themes.
        Returns:
        MenuBar containing the 3 settings - regular, dark and colour-blind modes.

      • changeTheme

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> changeTheme(java.lang.String stylesheet)
        Allows for changing colour theme of application.
        Parameters:
        stylesheet - - style to apply for the theme change
        Returns:
        An EventHandler for the on-click action
